name: Djinguereber Mosque
description: An ancient learning center and a prominent landmark, built in 1327, famous for its unique Sudano-Sahelian architecture. A UNESCO World Heritage site.

name: Sankore Mosque University
description: One of the three ancient centers of learning in Timbuktu, it served as a spiritual and intellectual hub for centuries, housing vast libraries and scholarly texts.

name: Ahmed Baba Institute
description: Dedicated to preserving ancient manuscripts of Timbuktu, this institute is a vital cultural repository showcasing the city's rich intellectual heritage.

name: Timbuktu Grand Market
description: A bustling hub of commerce where locals trade goods, spices, crafts, and traditional items. Offers a lively insight into daily life.

name: House of Explorer René Caillié
description: The modest house where the French explorer René Caillié stayed during his famous visit to Timbuktu in the 19th century, becoming the first European to return alive.

name: Sahara Desert Gateway
alt: Sand dunes at the edge of Timbuktu
description: Timbuktu serves as a historic gateway to the vast Sahara Desert, marking the intersection of ancient trade routes and providing breathtaking desert landscapes.

name: Local Artisan Workshops
description: Visit traditional workshops where local artisans create leather goods, intricate jewelry, and textiles using centuries-old techniques.

name: Timbuktu Public Library
alt: Interior of a traditional Timbuktu library
description: Beyond the ancient manuscripts, this library provides modern resources and serves as a community hub for education and literacy.
